parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The forward-leaning headrests can cause discomfort, neck pain, and headaches for drivers and passengers, potentially leading to driver distraction and fatigue, which can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: pushing the head and neck forward
and headaches; inability to find a comfortable driving position; difficulty wearing ponytails or hats due to headrest angle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden failure of the brakes can cause the vehicle to lose control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The brake pedal extends to the floorboard
the vehicle fails to stop or slows down unexpectedly
the brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the vehicle surges forward momentarily when the brakes are applied.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The close proximity of the brake and gas pedals can cause the driver to unintentionally accelerate while braking, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The brake pedal is too close to the accelerator pedal
the foot contacts the accelerator pedal while braking
the vehicle accelerates unexpectedly when the brake is applied
the vehicle jumps forward when the brake pedal is not fully depressed.
